Who: CYCLONUS, DARK RODIMUS
Location: Black Fortress - Security

Rodimus looked over at Cyclonus, his crimson optics glittering coldly
as he observed the ex-minion, his gaze difficult to read.

Rodimus' frame was tall and straight, and although he had once been
redesigned as a Prime, there was still something about his build that
was still lean, as if built for endurance and speed. His armor, even
in the bright lights of the security chamber, still somehow maintained
it's stark black on gray motif, stylized flames dancing across his
chest.

He glanced over at one of the screens, the one that was displaying the
activity outside with Tuscon and the other Autobot rabble standing
there as if expecting them to open the base up and let them in.
Rodimus chuckled softly for a moment, earning him a brief glance from
Cyclonus. Rodimus was about to say something when Hydras' voice cut in
. . .

> "We are under attack!!!!! We must to capture Nightshift, pronto!!!! Scourge and Cyclonus active the inner and exterior defenses... If the Autobot leaves the base we will be forced to go to a fight"

Cyclonus tilted his head curiously as he, and Rodimus for that matter,
looked at the screen that displayed the screen in the throne room and
the mayhem that was going on.

"Sir!?" Cyclonus sent to Hydras, "The base has been submerged
underneath the magma and I am activating the interior defenses."

Even as Cyclonus talked, a private message came to Rodimus from Hydras . . .

> "cover the reseach lab, if the autobot ran towards it, intercept him"

Rodimus acknowledged Hydras' message as he glanced up at Cyclonus. He
hadn't appeared to notice the message that Hydras sent. "I have some
things to attend to." Rodimus said, his voice calm and yet still that
undercurrent of aggression was still in it. "I'll be back."

Without another word Rodimus left the room, on his way to the research
lab . . . and Nightlight.

Cyclonus nodded as Rodimus left and then turned back to his consoles
and screens, another lit up beside him as he activated it, this one
watching Rodimus. Cyclonus had indeed been aware of the communication
Rodimus had received, and he watched his progress with keen interest,
even as he kept an optic on the other events.

(TAG)

Preston
